episode_summary: Live at the Royal Institution with guest Professor Alice Roberts, the team discuss a perilous first ascent into the stratosphere, historic misconceptions about blood and the circulation, and a real mineral with Superman-style “kryptonite” chemistry that could power EVs. They finish with how Pokemon was created to share the joy of insect collecting, with digressions into science history, EV safety, and archaeology.

facts.fact: The first person to travel into the stratosphere did so with a pillow on his head.
people used to think that arteries carried air not blood and that the airways themselves were full of fluid.
theoretically electric cars could run on kryptonite.
Pokemon was invented so that others could experience the joy of insect hunting.
